page.title: 08Merdon Castle (1)
page.content: The origins of Merdon Castle lay in an iron age hill fort dating from about 100BC . The fort was not strategically well-placed and may have been a hideout within the forest . Later there may have been a Roman Settlement here . The Saxons built a wooden fort within the outer rampart of earthworks in about 500AD . Although little is known of this fort, King Cynewulf of the West Saxons was murdered here in 757AD , and Ethelred and Alfred were defeated by the Danes in a battle at Merdon in 871AD . In 1138 at the time of the Stephen and Matilda wars Bishop Henry de Blois , of Winchester , built a stone castle also within the earthworks . Bishop Henry was Stephen's half brother . Still its stategic purpose was not clear and for 300 years it was used as a palace , mainly for hunting.
